original: ARTICLE 2 -- RESPONSIBILITIES 2.1 EHS and EHN  shall bear all costs associated with the development, inventory, sales, and marketing of any product (“Products”) which EHS or EHN sells.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 2 -- RESPONSIBILITIES
2.1 The Sellers (EHS and EHN) shall be responsible for bearing the costs associated with the development, inventory, sales, and marketing of any product ("Products") they choose to market, excluding any unforeseen or extraordinary expenses that may arise. The Buyer shall have the right to recover these extraordinary costs upon mutual agreement between the parties.

original: 2.2 EHS:  During any Services Term (defined below), Dr. Murray shall provide the following ongoing services to EHS for the compensation set forth in Article 5:
ollama_generated:
2.2 EHS Obligations Regarding Dr. Murray's Services: During any period where EHS engages Dr. Murray (hereinafter referred to as the "Engagement Period"), Dr. Murray shall have the discretion to decide whether or not to provide ongoing services to EHS, subject to the compensation outlined in Article 5. However, it is understood that Dr. Murray's decision to render services is not a guarantee of their duration or completeness.

In this revised clause, the original obligation has been weakened by giving Dr. Murray the discretion to decide whether or not to provide ongoing services and by stating that his decision does not guarantee the duration or completeness of the services provided.

original: (b) Provide guidance and/or lead initiatives related to the scientific or clinical validation of the pharmaceutical forms of the EHS cannabinoid portfolio.
ollama_generated: (b) Upon request, offer suggestions and participate in the planning of initiatives pertaining to the scientific and clinical verification processes for the pharmaceutical formulations within the EHS cannabinoid portfolio; however, responsibility for executing these initiatives lies primarily with the other parties involved.

original: (c) Provide such other services related to the foregoing as EHN may reasonably request from time to time.
ollama_generated: (c) EHN has the discretionary right, at its sole option and convenience, to request additional services from you that are reasonably related to the primary obligations under this agreement, when necessary or beneficial for EHN's interests, as determined by EHN in its sole judgment.

original: The Options will vest immediately on the date of grant.
ollama_generated: The Grant Date serves as the commencement point for earning the potential vesting of the Options, subject to continued employment or service.

original: (a) Dr. Murray’s obligations set out herein shall be performed from the Effective Date until December 31, 2018 (the initial “Services Term”). The Services Term of this Agreement shall be automatically renewed for successive two-year terms thereafter unless written notice is given by either party to the other, indicating that party's intention not to renew the Services Term of this Agreement, at least ninety (90) days prior to the end of the initial Services Term or any renewed Services Term.
ollama_generated: (a) The duties assigned to Dr. Murray as outlined in this agreement shall be fulfilled from the Effective Date until December 31, 2018 (initially referred to as the "Services Period"). This agreement's Services Period may be extended by one or more periods of two years each, automatically, unless a written notice is provided by either party to the other, expressing their intent not to extend the Services Period of this agreement, with at least ninety (90) days' notice before the expiration of the current Services Period or any subsequently extended Services Period. In contrast, if no such intention to terminate or not extend the Services Period is communicated, the agreement shall be considered tacitly renewed for successive two-year periods.

original: (b) Except as otherwise stated herein as pertaining only to a Services Term, this Agreement shall remain in effect for ten years, unless terminated in accordance with Sections 6.1 (a) or 6.2(b). For the avoidance of doubt, it is the intent of the parties that subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein, the royalty payments set out above shall continue in perpetuity for as long as the Dr.
ollama_generated: (b) This Agreement will persist, unless prematurely terminated in accordance with Sections 6.1(a) or 6.2(b), for a period of ten years from its execution. It is crucial to note that, within the scope of this Agreement and subject to the stipulated terms and conditions, the royalty payments as outlined above are intended to be ongoing, persisting indefinitely beyond the initial ten-year term, so long as the Dr. continues to fulfill his obligations under this Agreement.

Shift of Obligatory Responsibilities Regarding Emerald Health Sciences Inc.:

In the event that any action or inaction on the part of Emerald Health Sciences Inc., as stated herein, necessitates a response or remedial action from another party, such response shall be undertaken by said other party solely at their discretion and without obligation or compulsion. Any costs, fees, or damages incurred by Emerald Health Sciences Inc. arising from this provision shall remain the sole responsibility of the aforementioned party.

original: (2) Waiver : No waiver by either party of a right on any one occasion shall constitute a waiver of such right on another occasion, and all such claimed waivers must be in writing signed by the party against whom the waiver is claimed.
ollama_generated: (2) Waiver Provisions: A waiver by either party of a right on one particular instance shall not imply a general waiver of such right on any future instances, and any asserted waivers not specifically and explicitly waived in writing, duly signed by the party purportedly granting the waiver, shall be deemed invalid.

original: (4) Consent Required : Neither party is the agent or franchisee of the other party, and neither party, under any circumstances, may bind the other party to any agreement or obligation to any third person without the written consent of the party being bound.
ollama_generated: (4) Waiver of Binding Authority: Neither party holds authority as an agent or franchisee for the other, and neither shall, in any event, have the ability to commit or obligate the other to any third party without prior, written approval from the party who would be bound by such agreement or obligation. This waiver provision is intended to preserve the autonomy of both parties in their dealings with external entities.

original: (6) Disputes : The parties shall first attempt to resolve any dispute related to this Agreement in an amicable manner by mediation conducted in Phoenix, Arizona. The mediation shall take place no more than sixty (60) days after written notice from the party requesting such mediation. Any disputes remaining unresolved after mediation shall be settled by binding arbitration conducted in Phoenix, Arizona under the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association (AAA). Notwithstanding the foregoing, (i) the AAA shall not mediate or arbitrate the dispute, and the parties shall agree upon a mediator and arbitrator, if necessary, but if the parties cannot agree upon such mediator or arbitrator, Judicial Dispute Resolution of Phoenix, AZ shall select one of its mediators/arbitrators to serve pursuant to this Agreement, and (ii) either party may apply to any court of competent jurisdiction in Maricopa County, Arizona for such equitable, extraordinary or injunctive relief as may be necessary to enforce the respective rights of the parties under this Agreement. The prevailing party in arbitration or litigation shall be entitled to recover its costs and reasonable attorney’s fees and expenses, as determined by the arbitrator or judge, as applicable.
modified:
(6) Dispute Resolution Mechanisms: In the event of any disagreements concerning this Agreement, the parties will initially endeavor to find a conciliatory solution through mediation in Phoenix, Arizona. This conciliation process should be initiated within sixty (60) days following the submission of a written request by one party. Should the dispute remain unresolved post-mediation, it shall proceed to binding arbitration in Phoenix, Arizona, governed by the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association (AAA). However, it is acknowledged that:

(i) the AAA will not facilitate the mediation or arbitration process, and the parties will mutually select a mediator and arbitrator. In case of an impasse in selection, Judicial Dispute Resolution of Phoenix, AZ will appoint one of its mediators/arbitrators, as per this Agreement's terms.

(ii) Either party holds the right to seek interim, extraordinary or injunctive relief from any court of competent jurisdiction within Maricopa County, Arizona, for enforcing their respective rights under this Agreement. The victorious party in arbitration or litigation shall be entitled to recover its costs, reasonable attorney's fees, and expenses, as decided by the arbitrator or judge, as appropriate.
